title: Why is the UN Security Council still criticised? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your question implies that the criticism is a recent thing. The UNSC has been criticized for decades. The UNSC is real politics in a very clear and direct manor. There are many people that want the UN to the shining city on the hill, the promise of a great and just future. What it is is something else. It is a place where counties come to talk to each other. The UNSC is one of sub groups of the UN. It contains some of the world’s great powers, which means that when it agrees to something, it has the implicit (or even somethings the explicit) backing of the world’s great powers. Or, I may have just misunderstood your question. Are you asking why people still complain about the UNSC, given that doing so is like a beating a dead horse (a pointless waste of time that doesn’t accomplice anything)?

Society in general would love to see black & white decisions on the UNSC, but back on the real world things doesn't work like that. The United Nations were not mean to take the world to heave but to avoid human destruction.
